isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 5 Engine Service Manual - Power Cylinder - Installation

svcproc.title: Piston Assembly

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, make sure the connecting rod and piston are assembled correctly.

figure.caption: Offset for incorrect rod cap assembly

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, the rod cap can only be correctly installed on the connecting rod if it is oriented in the correct direction. If the rod cap is reversed during assembly of the connecting rod, an obvious offset will be seen at the mating surfaces. If the connecting rod assembly is installed on the crankshaft in this manner, the connecting rod must be replaced. Also check the crank pin fillets for damage. Such damage will require replacement of the crankshaft.

svcproc.para: Assemble the piston rings, piston, and connecting rod as follows:

figure.caption: Proper position of installed connecting rod

calloutgroup.callout1: Longer leg of connecting rod (cam side)
"CAM V8" stamped on cam side of piston crown

step1.para: Connect piston to connecting rod as follows:

step2.para: Lubricate connecting rod piston pin bore, piston pin bore, and piston pin with clean engine oil.
Orient the longer leg of the connecting rod with the side of the piston bearing the "CAM V8" stamped in its crown.
Using pliers, install retaining ring at one end of piston pin bore.
Slide piston pin through bored holes, stopping at installed retaining ring.
Check to see if the piston slides easily on piston pin from one snap ring to the other.

step1.para: Using Piston ring expansion pliers , install piston rings as follows:

step2.para: Install expansion spring component of two piece oil control ring into bottom piston groove.
Install oil scraper component of two piece oil control ring over expansion spring.

figure.caption: Piston ring identification marks (top ring shown)

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, make sure piston rings are installed correctly. Both intermediate and compression rings have the same identification markings. The intermediate ring has a square cross section. The top compression ring has a keystone cross section.

step2.para: Install intermediate ring (rectangular cross section) into middle piston groove with identification mark facing up. The intermediate ring is identified by one 'O' mark on the top surface of ring.
Install compression ring (keystone cross section) into top piston groove with identification mark facing up. The compression ring is identified by the 'O' mark on the top surface of ring.

step1.para: Space ring gaps approximately 120° apart after ring installation.
